questions.question: In the simple linear regression model Y = β0 + β1X + ε, what does the slope (β1) represent?

answers.b: The average exam score of all students
answers.c: The average increase in exam score for each additional hour studied
answers.d: The random error added to the prediction

explanations.a: This refers to Y, not the slope.
explanations.b: The average score is computed from data, not represented by β1.
explanations.c: Correct! β1 represents how much the exam score changes for every additional hour studied.
explanations.d: ε represents the random error, not β1.

questions.question: What does the intercept (β0) indicate in the linear regression equation?

answers.a: The exam score when study hours are zero
answers.c: The strength of correlation between X and Y
answers.d: The error added to the model

explanations.a: Correct! β0 represents the expected score when X = 0.
explanations.b: Variance is unrelated to the intercept.
explanations.c: Correlation is not represented by β0.
explanations.d: The error term is ε, not β0.

questions.question: Which metric is used to measure the average squared error between predicted and actual exam scores?

explanations.a: Standard deviation measures spread, not prediction error.
explanations.b: RMSE is the square root of MSE, not the MSE itself.
explanations.c: Correct! MSE measures the average squared difference between predicted and actual values.
explanations.d: R-squared measures variance explained, not error.

questions.question: Why do we split the dataset into training (80%) and testing (20%) sets?

answers.a: To visualize the scatter plot more clearly
answers.b: To check how well the model performs on unseen data
answers.c: To remove outliers from the dataset
answers.d: To increase the size of the dataset artificially

explanations.a: Visualization is not the reason for splitting data.
explanations.b: Correct! Testing data helps evaluate model generalization.
explanations.c: Outlier removal is part of preprocessing, not dataset splitting.
explanations.d: Splitting does not increase dataset size.

questions.question: Which assumption must hold true for applying simple linear regression?

answers.a: There should be a linear relationship between study hours and exam score
answers.b: The dataset must contain more than 1000 rows
answers.c: Study hours must follow a normal distribution
answers.d: The exam scores must have no variance

explanations.a: Correct! Linear regression requires a linear relationship between X and Y.
explanations.b: There is no such minimum dataset size requirement.
explanations.c: Normality of X is not a strict requirement for simple linear regression.
explanations.d: If scores have no variance, regression cannot be performed.

questions.question: Why is Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) performed before fitting the regression model?

answers.a: To visually check if a linear trend exists between study hours and exam scores
answers.b: To automatically compute the regression coefficients β0 and β1
answers.c: To convert categorical variables into numerical values
answers.d: To remove the linear relationship from the data

explanations.a: Correct! EDA helps confirm linearity and understand the data.
explanations.b: Coefficients are computed during model fitting, not EDA.
explanations.d: Regression requires a linear relationship; removing it is not useful.
